Mewdeko Docs
Edit this page

Class Searches

Base class for Discord command modules with a specified service type and support for localization and string resources.

Namespace: Mewdeko.Modules.Searches
Assembly: Mewdeko.dll
Syntax
public class Searches : MewdekoModuleBase<SearchesService>, IModuleBase

Constructors

| Edit this page View Source

Searches(IBotCredentials, IGoogleApiService, IHttpClientFactory, IMemoryCache, GuildTimezoneService, InteractiveService, MartineApi, ToneTagService, BotConfigService, INsfwSpy)

The Searches module provides commands for searching and retrieving various types of information. It includes commands for searching memes, Reddit posts, weather, and more.

Declaration
public Searches(IBotCredentials creds, IGoogleApiService google, IHttpClientFactory factory, IMemoryCache cache, GuildTimezoneService tzSvc, InteractiveService serv, MartineApi martineApi, ToneTagService toneTagService, BotConfigService config, INsfwSpy nsfwSpy)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IBotCredentials creds

The bot credentials.
IGoogleApiService google

The Google API service.
IHttpClientFactory factory

The HTTP client factory.
IMemoryCache cache

The memory cache service.
GuildTimezoneService tzSvc

The guild timezone service.
InteractiveService serv

The interactive service.
MartineApi martineApi

The Martine API service.
ToneTagService toneTagService

The ToneTag service.
BotConfigService config

The bot configuration service.
INsfwSpy nsfwSpy

The NSFW spy service.

Bible(string, string)

Searches for and displays Bible verses based on the book, chapter, and verse provided.

Declaration
[Cmd("Bible")]
[Aliases("Bible")]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
public Task Bible(string book, string chapterAndVerse)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string book

The book of the Bible.
string chapterAndVerse

The chapter and verse in the format "Chapter:Verse".
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command retrieves and displays a specific Bible verse or set of verses. The response includes the text of the verses along with their book, chapter, and verse reference.

Examples
.bible "John" "3:16"

[Aliases("Catfact")]

Color(params SKColor[])

Displays a color swatch based on the provided hexadecimal color codes.

Declaration

[Aliases("Color")]
public Task Color(params SKColor[] colors)
Parameters
Type Name Description
SKColor[] colors

An array of SKColor objects representing the colors to display.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command creates an image consisting of color swatches for each provided color code. It's useful for visualizing colors or sharing color schemes with others.

Examples
.color #FFFFFF #FF0000 #0000FF

Define(string)

Retrieves and displays a definition from the Pearson dictionary.

Declaration
[Cmd("Define")]
[Aliases("Define")]
public Task Define(string word)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string word

The word to define.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command looks up a given word in the Pearson dictionary and displays its definition, part of speech, and an example sentence if available. Results are presented in a paginated format to navigate through multiple definitions.

Examples
.define "ubiquitous"
| Edit this page View Source

Google(string?)

Performs a general search using the Google or DuckDuckGo search engines and displays the results.

Declaration
[Cmd("Google")]
[Aliases("Google")]
public Task Google(string? query = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string query

The search query.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command conducts a web search using the specified query. If Google does not return results, DuckDuckGo is used as a fallback. Results are displayed in an embed format, providing users with a title, snippet, and link for each result.

Examples
.google search_terms
| Edit this page View Source

Hearthstone(string)

Searches for and displays information about a Hearthstone card.

Declaration
[Cmd("Hearthstone")]
[Aliases("Hearthstone")]
public Task Hearthstone(string name)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string name

The name of the Hearthstone card to search for.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command searches for a Hearthstone card by name and displays its image and flavor text, if available. It requires a valid Mashape API key set in the bot's configuration to access the Hearthstone API.

Examples
.hearthstone "Leeroy Jenkins"
| Edit this page View Source

Image(string)

Performs an image search using Google and DuckDuckGo, then filters out NSFW results.

Declaration
[Cmd("Image")]
[Aliases("Image")]
[Ratelimit(20)]
public Task Image(string query)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string query

The search query for the image.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command uses both Google and DuckDuckGo to perform an image search based on the provided query. It then filters out NSFW results using NsfwSpy and presents the safe images in a paginated embed format.

Examples
.image query
| Edit this page View Source

Lmgtfy(string?)

Generates a Let Me Google That For You (LMGTFY) link for the provided query.

Declaration
[Cmd("Lmgtfy")]
[Aliases("Lmgtfy")]
public Task Lmgtfy(string? ffs = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string ffs

The search query to be used in the LMGTFY link.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command takes a search query as input and generates a LMGTFY link. The LMGTFY link is then shortened using the google.ShortenUrl method and sent to the channel. If the provided query is null or whitespace, the command will return without sending a message.

Examples
.lmgtfy query
| Edit this page View Source

MagicTheGathering(string)

Fetches and displays information about a Magic: The Gathering card.

Declaration
[Cmd("MagicTheGathering")]
[Aliases("MagicTheGathering")]
public Task MagicTheGathering(string search)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string search

The name or identifier of the Magic: The Gathering card to search for.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Utilizing an external API, this command retrieves details about a specified Magic: The Gathering card, including its name, description, mana cost, types, and an image if available. The information is presented in an embed format.

Examples
.magicthegathering "Black Lotus"

This command uses the MartineApi to retrieve a random meme from a predefined list of subreddits. It displays the meme in an embed format, including the title, author, subreddit, and a link to the original post.

RandomReddit(string)

Fetches and displays a random post from a specified subreddit.

Declaration
[Cmd("RandomReddit")]
[Aliases("RandomReddit")]
public Task RandomReddit(string subreddit)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string subreddit

The subreddit from which to fetch a random post.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command checks if the specified subreddit is marked as NSFW. If it is not, it fetches a random post. It displays the post in an embed format, including the title, author, subreddit, and a link to the original post.

Examples
.randomreddit sylveon
| Edit this page View Source

ResolveToneTags(string)

Resolves tone tags in a message and provides explanations for each identified tag.

Declaration
[Cmd("ResolveToneTags")]
[Aliases("ResolveToneTags")]
public Task ResolveToneTags(string tag)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string tag

The message containing tone tags to be resolved.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Tone tags are short codes used to express the tone of a message. This command parses the message for known tone tags and returns their meanings to help clarify the intended tone of the message. This is particularly useful in text-based communication where conveying tone can be challenging.

Examples
.resolvetonetags "I'm happy to help! /s"
| Edit this page View Source

Revav(IGuildUser?)

Performs a reverse image search using an avatar link.

Declaration
[Cmd("Revav")]
[Aliases("Revav")]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
public Task Revav(IGuildUser? usr = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IGuildUser usr
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command utilizes Google, TinEye, and Yandex reverse image search engines to find similar images or the source of the given image. It provides links to the search results on each platform, offering users multiple avenues to explore related or source images.

Examples
.revimg @user
| Edit this page View Source

Revimg(string?)

Performs a reverse image search using the provided image link.

Declaration
[Cmd("Revimg")]
[Aliases("Revimg")]
public Task Revimg(string? imageLink = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string imageLink

The direct URL of the image to search for.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command utilizes Google, TinEye, and Yandex reverse image search engines to find similar images or the source of the given image. It provides links to the search results on each platform, offering users multiple avenues to explore related or source images.

Examples
.revimg "http://example.com/image.jpg"

Task
Remarks

Examples

Safebooru(string?)

Searches for and displays an image based on the provided tag from Safebooru.

Declaration
[Cmd("Safebooru")]
[Aliases("Safebooru")]
public Task Safebooru(string? tag = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string tag

The tag to search for on Safebooru.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command uses the Safebooru API to fetch an image related to the specified tag. It is designed to provide safe-for-work images from a variety of anime and manga sources. The resulting image is posted in the channel where the command was used.

Examples
.safebooru tag_name
| Edit this page View Source

Shorten(string)

Shortens a provided URL using the goolnk.com API.

Declaration
[Cmd("Shorten")]
[Aliases("Shorten")]
public Task Shorten(string query)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string query

The URL to be shortened.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command submits the specified URL to the goolnk.com API to generate a shortened version. The shortened URL is then returned and displayed in the channel. This is useful for sharing long URLs in a more concise format.

Examples
.shorten https://example.com/very/long/url
| Edit this page View Source

Steam(string)

Searches for a game on Steam by name and provides a link to its Steam Store page.

Declaration
[Cmd("Steam")]
[Aliases("Steam")]
public Task Steam(string query)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string query

The name of the game to search for on Steam.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command searches for a game on Steam using the provided query. If the game is found, it returns a direct link to the game's page on the Steam Store. It's useful for quickly sharing Steam Store pages of games within the Discord channel.

Examples
.steam "Half-Life 3"

Parameters
Type Name Description
string input

The input string to localize, followed by optional arguments separated by "|".
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command is designed for developers to test and demonstrate the localization of strings within the bot. It accepts an input string and optional arguments to format the localized message.

Examples
.testlocalize "greeting|world"

ValidateQuery(IMessageChannel, string)

Validates if the given query string is not null or whitespace.

Declaration
public Task<bool> ValidateQuery(IMessageChannel ch, string query)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IMessageChannel ch

The channel from which the command was invoked.
string query

The query string to validate.
Returns
Type Description
Task<bool>

True if the query is valid, otherwise false.
Remarks

This utility method checks if a query string provided in a command is valid. It ensures that commands requiring input do not proceed with empty or whitespace-only queries.

Examples

This method is called internally by commands requiring input validation and does not have a direct command example.

Wiki(string?)

Searches for and displays Wikipedia information based on the provided query.

Declaration
[Cmd("Wiki")]
[Aliases("Wiki")]
public Task Wiki(string? query = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string query

The search term for Wikipedia.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command searches Wikipedia for the specified query and returns the first matching page. If a page is found, it displays the page title and a link to the full article.

Examples
.wiki "Quantum mechanics" (nobody will ever actually search for this on discord)
